reviews.review_msg: She is cool. she teaches what she's supposed to.

FOR FAN STUDENTS, She's very good at explaining things clearly and takes her time to make sure the class knows what's going on. Sometimes it is a bit too slow but it might be better than rushing it. I have difficulty with math so I was glad that she was able to strengthen my foundation of the subject. Her analogies help out a lot.

Ami was brutal!!! I did not find her helpful at all....so those of you who need to upgrade your math skilss...avoid her at all costs. Take Malgorzata Dubiel instead. Dubiel is wonderful!! As for Ami, she really needs to learn patience with those who do not excel in math.

This class was HARD. and it's suppose to be an upgrade math course. Course was hard, but ami was a great prof imo. Problem solving was difficult, midterm was easy, final was so-so. My TA wasn't very helpful for this course...
course is the problem
the course was not created by her and it is mainly TA and coordinator marking who are strict on it. she just follow on what is in the plan and this course takes up half of our time. its not helping
the professor isn't the problem, the course is since it takes up half our time and she follows the course outline which is created by the math department

Personally absolutely terrible experience in this class. Loved to publicly humiliate students and got frustrated when we didn't understand a concept. Hands down worst attitude I've ever encountered throughout university. Laughed at students' questions when they actually build up the courage to ask.

Average prof. Teaching ability is fine and the content is pretty easy, but she has a very poor attitude. Like others have said she is downright rude to students. Has obvious favourites and no problem bullying those she doesn't like. Enjoys publicly humiliating people.
Not a good teacher. Shiva is also I very hard marker. She's difficult to understand at times and down right rude when you ask her questions. Don't bother buying the textbook, it's never used.

I absolutely hate math, and I hate SFU even more for making someone in Arts take this. But whatever. Shiva wasn't the best prof, but she tried her best to help us. She was really nice when you went up and asked her questions.

worst class ever! I can't believe how stupid sfu is for making you take this course. It's honestly a waste of time and money. I don't see how any of the content is helpful in life. such a b.s. university.
coolest math teacher ever! she is so smart! I wish I could borrow her brain going into the exam!

This class was good because as someone who has never taken math before, I really got to understand the basics of math. She is a good teacher and knows her stuff! I do not think math 100 should have fan x99 as a prerequisite because a) so irrelevant b) B-? are u freakin kidding me? it's for people who have never taken math before! wtf!

Amazing prof! I hate math, but she made it fun! I just didn't think this course helped at all going into math 100. Two different things! I do not understand why it's a prerequisite for math 100! But Shiva made it fun regardless!

She was very nice and helpful for students who were not so good for math. Her assignments were fairly easy, and she was always available by email and office hours. I recommend her all the way she is a very nice person.

are you sure we're talking about the same women. she's probably the worst , did not understand a thing , teaching style was " you think about it , I don't know ". All she told me or helped me was tell me to think , if i knew woman , i wouldn't be in this class. only taught 3 word problem in the duration of a two hour class. quite useless.

She is awesome and very helpful and friendly! Crystal clear! there were a lot of immature idiots in our class but she was VERY patient with all of them and helped them regardless!!!!!! and she is gorgeous!
Ping Ding is a nice prof, but his accent makes it hard to understand what he is saying at times. Quizzes very easy. Midterms not bad. The annoying stuff was weekly online and hand in hwk.

Ms. Dubiels course is the worst course I have ever taken. The professor would only teach the class one problem a day and we would be screwed for the quiz every Tuesday unless we had other assistance. The professor had a very thick accent and therefore was difficult to understand, and sometimes didnt even know the answers to probkems she gave us.

Best prof I've ever had. Nominated her for excellence award -- she already has one! No surprise. Inspires students to be interested in math. If you meet her half-way she will do everything to help you succeed. Funny, cute, wise, just amazing.

Amazing teacher! After not having a high enough grade in high school pre calculus I was discouraged about taking a mandatory math class in university, but Malgorzata got me from a C+ to an A-! She is always open to helping those who don't understand, but it's up to you to ask for help. Also gives extra credit if you ask for it.

I love her, she is awesome! I just hate how she changed the final required grade to get into math 100, from a C to a B-!!!! We are talkin about students who are bad in math or have never taken math before!!!!! How on earth do u expect a B-????? I'm never taking math at sfu again, in fact, I'm never taking math again! I don't even need it

she is awesome! i never had her as a prof but she was always at the Q center helping students!!! I never knew SHE was dr.malgorzata dubiel until the day of the final! she was very helpful and i do STRONLY recommend her!!!!
Amazing prof! Prior to this course I was terrible at math and hated it, now it's easy and I don't mind it. If you ever get the chance to take a class with her, do it.

She does tend to go on for quite a bit, and her accent is thick, but she is so helpful and really does go out of her way to try and make sure that everyone is on the same page. I would'nt have gotten through this class without her.

Patient but prefers to give a nudge in the right direction if asked for help rather than just giving the answer - better for genuine learning. Try to consistently sit with the same group of people and learn to work collaboratively to help each other understand the material during study time; great opportunity to reinforce comprehension by teaching.

There are no lectures. He spends one full class doing practice problems and then the second, he spends 15 minutes on a quiz and then back to problems. Mind you, the problems were not helpful for the midterms or the final. The first midterm was alright but the second one was terrible because he did not prepare us for it. The final was the worst.
Excellent prof. Very helpful, and understanding. Very very funny. He is one of the best profs at SFU!

Very funny teacher with a lot of random sarcastic comments!  He does a good job of explaining concepts and guides you in the right direction as to what will be on the mid-terms and final.  I hate math but Keshav made it bearable.
Very interested in subject matter and tried hard to expalin things in a meaningful way.
Jamie was great.  He totally clarified anything that you could notunderstand.  He was non-intimidating and was just simply a great professor.

Petra is honestly the best prof you could ever have for this math class. She seems intimidating at first, but she's quite funny and wants you to succeed. I took this course just for credit and usually am bad at math, but she helped me succeed. The exams are very similar to the practice exams she gives so study those and you should be good.

This is my second time taking this class, and Petra was amazing! She really helped me understand the concepts & really cared that the class tried. She's German, so seems tough, but is super respectful & funny. The course is ran by a bunch of profs and TAs tho, so there are weekly quizzes, weekly assignments, and weekly online stuff.

i loved petra! she can seem a little intimidating, but once you get to know her, she's honestly so funny. she's very passionate about math and really wants her students to succeed. her exams were fair, and were very similar to the sample ones she posts on canvas. as long as you put in the work and participate, you will do well in the class.
The quote I will remember Cory, my math teacher, by for years to come: "Its not my fault my work was wrong! I'm not very good at math!" Brilliant.
very heavy in courseload which takes up half your week and nothing we get assigned is on quizzes and exams

currently crying over the final bc what is even this course? a normal person would think about maths which includes numbers while taking a basic maths class but this class is basically solving extremely weird word problems which are over 65% materials of the exam. the word problems being said is a bunch of riddles that u need to figure out.
Why have I done 20+ hours of homework a week for an upgrading class hahahhahahahahahhahahahahah. This is so silly

3 quizzes a week (2-3 hours of work each) and 2 assignments a week (4-6 hours each). Crazy work load, no actual teaching done (you're going to love chat gpt!), hope you like word problems! People crying during each midterm, snarky ta's, exams/quizzes don't reflect homework. Horrible horrible experience! Avoid doing this class with her.

Sophie is fine, but her ability to teach in this class is lacking. You'll spend the entire 2 hour lecture doing 2 word problems that don't have anything to do with the material. The only reason I put hilarious is because this class is a joke. I recommend taking the online option, as it will save you time/stress that could be easily avoided.
BS class w/ BS word problems. Too vague in marking. An Art history major should not be required to take this class.

Sophie is a nice person, but not such a good prof. Her lectures are always focused on puzzles and does not really teach much, a student is expected to learn all the material themselves. Marking is super tough. Marks get cut off for the tiniest mistake, and she expects at least a paragraph explaining how you got the answer. Hard midterms.

Nice lady but horrible course. Seriously run away as fast as you can. I'm in BUS and just trying to get into my Econ 103. I recommend everyone look into retaking their high school math before taking this course for upgrading.
Really wasn't a fan of the 10 minute quizzes or the strange word problems. The TA's are insane markers so watch out.

Unfair marker. That's about the best way to summarize. For FANX99 you'll have at least 3 assignments due each week and unless you go to every workshop you'll never get 10/10 on the assignments. Type of marker to always find something wrong. Makes a supposed "easy" upgrading class hell. It's also 4 credits for no reason (except to charge you more)
She was a great prof. She was always really helpful and was able to make class fun.
He is the best instructor ever even though I got low grade

Attend workshop, do word problems, easy A. Iain does a great job with even the least "mathy people". He helps you in workshops, rephrases concepts to help you understand better, and sets you up for success with study tips. Witty/ has a great sense of humor. Can be inspiring if you are looking to continue on with math and Uchoose to pick his brain.
Good prof who actually helps with work.
clearly cares about his students passing and will prolong his office hours. very likeable and funny, overall a great prof :)
HE IS AMAZING!!! TAKE ANY MATH COURSE WITH MIKE, ESPECIALLY IF YOU'RE NOT FROM A MATH BACKGROUND!

Mike was an integral part of mine and others passing FANX99, providing clear instruction, examples, and solutions to complex problems. His class consisted of group work on chalkboards tackling a few problems per class, and required weekly LON-CAPA, quizzes, and written assignments. He is very available for help, and wants and helps you to succeed!
Mr. Pruner was awesome! Always available to help, great knowledge and hilarious. I would recommend him to anybody that needs to take FAN!

He teaches a very tough course- all students in FANx99 are there because of their extreme struggles with math in all its forms. He's super helpful, super sweet, and super supportive. Even if you hate math (like I do), he makes the subject at the very least tolerable. Amazing guy!
Very passionate teacher. Always willing to help. If you have to take FANX, take it with Mike!
not very helpful
First day of class she throws a question for everyone to answer, chooses someone to answer, and then criticize their answer without giving out her own solution. This went on for the rest of the year.

Personally, this was an easy A+. Not so for the general class. You MUST show up for her quizzes and exams - no make-ups permitted. She isn't the easiest to understand (Romanian accent), but treats you well if you try and don't give her lip. Definitely do your online assignments and written homework. Be prepared for lots of word problems.

Do not take this class  unless you're a good self learner. She expects you to know all rules and details of math equations, although many are taking this to upgrade their mark.  I did not find her to be a good professor. All you did in class was go through word problems and none of the weekly material.. would not recommend taking FAN with her.

If you're not a self taught person be prepared to drop her class. Although she is very nice as a person, as a prof I wouldn't recommend her. Her teaching methods are not clear, and she had a hard time understanding my questions. Her lectures are long and useless (Unless there was a quiz that day) and she drags the class without teaching anything.

Elena seems like she's interested in her topic but you can barely understand her. She's also quite rude for no reason. Incl. her thick accent, she gives no clear instruction and kind of drags the class along in the dark. Basically a self-teach class, as the notes are left for you to read online and class "lectures" consist of endless word problems.

This course requires you to actually do some work. Math is something I've struggled with & actually attending the Q workshops helped out tons, unlike the rest of the complainers who sat in class laughing the entire time & didnt go. No wonder they did poorly. Elena was VERY helpful if you actually pay attention and come to class willing to learn.
Elena has such a calm way about you and I really appreciated her ability to explain things to us in a way that was easily understandable.
Not clear at all. Without friends and youtube would not have passed this class. She was useless.
really horrible class! do not take!
